name: cnvkit_batch
title: CNVkit
summary: Call copy number variants from DNA sequencing, and/or build a reference profile

inputSpec.name: case_bams
inputSpec.label: Case/test/tumor sample mapped reads (BAM)
inputSpec.help: Mapped reads for each case/test/tumor sample, in BAM format. CNVs will be called in these samples.

inputSpec.name: normal_bams
inputSpec.label: Control/normal sample mapped reads (BAM)
inputSpec.help: Mapped reads for each normal/control sample, in BAM format. Used to construct a new copy number reference. If neither normal_bams nor cn_reference is given, a 'generic' or 'flat' reference will be created with equal expected coverage across the genome.

inputSpec.name: vcfs
inputSpec.label: SNV calls (VCF)
inputSpec.help: Variant calls for each tumor sample, including germline SNPs. Must be in the same order as the tumor BAMs. See VCF formatting guidelines: https://cnvkit.readthedocs.io/en/stable/fileformats.html#vcf

inputSpec.name: cn_reference
inputSpec.label: Copy number reference
inputSpec.help: Reference profile (.cnn), previously built using CNVkit. If given, this will be used directly to call CNVs in the given tumor samples; none of the other inputs apply in this case.

inputSpec.name: baits
inputSpec.label: Baited regions
inputSpec.help: Baited (tiled, targeted) genomic regions, in BED or GATK/Picard-style interval list format. Required to construct a new reference.

inputSpec.name: fasta
inputSpec.label: Reference genome (FASTA)
inputSpec.help: Reference genomic sequences of all chromosomes, in FASTA format

inputSpec.name: annotation
inputSpec.label: Gene annotation
inputSpec.help: UCSC genome annotation database file, e.g. refFlat.txt for the RefSeq annotation of your reference genome. Used to apply gene names to targets/baits, if the 'baits' BED file does not have a fourth column of region names.

inputSpec.name: method
inputSpec.label: Sequencing method
inputSpec.help: Target capture method, if any: 'hybrid' (hybridization capture; the default), 'amplicon' (targeted amplicon capture), or 'wgs' (whole genome sequencing -- no capture step)

inputSpec.name: haploid_x_reference
inputSpec.label: Assume chrX is haploid?
inputSpec.help: If true, assume or create a reference where chromosome X is haploid, rather than the default diploid. This option can be used to emulate some array CGH platforms.

inputSpec.name: drop_low_coverage
inputSpec.label: Filter out very-low-coverage bins?
inputSpec.help: Recommended for tumor samples, where very-low-coverage bins generally indicate poorly sequenced regions rather than copy number. This option removes those bins before segmentation.

inputSpec.name: exclude_access
inputSpec.label: Regions to exclude from off-target bins

optional.name: purity
optional.label: Estimated tumor purity
optional.help: Fraction, 0--1, of cells in each test sample that are lesional, rather than immune or normal-cell contamination. For germline samples, this is 1.0 and does not need to be specified.

optional.name: ploidy
optional.label: Autosome ploidy
optional.help: Number of copies of each chromosome expected in normal cells (excluding sex chromosomes and mitochondria). For humans, this is 2.

optional.name: do_parallel
optional.label: Parallelize?
optional.help: Run the pipeline on all available CPUs in parallel. Turn this off if you experience app crashes.

outputSpec.name: copy_segments
outputSpec.label: Copy segments (.cns)
outputSpec.help: Segmentation of the bin-level copy ratios (.cnr), with no further processing.

outputSpec.name: call_segments
outputSpec.label: Filtered segments (.cns)
outputSpec.help: Copy segments re-centered and filtered for 50% confidence interval versus neutral copy number. Integer copy numbers are rough estimates and can be improved by supplying 'purity' input values.

outputSpec.name: gainloss
outputSpec.label: Gain/loss tables (.csv)
outputSpec.help: Lists of genes putatively gained or lost in each sample, as detected in the filtered segments (call_segments).

outputSpec.name: breaks
outputSpec.label: Breakpoints tables (.csv)
outputSpec.help: Lists of genes containing possible breakpoints in each sample, as detected in the filtered segments (call_segments).

outputSpec.name: vcf
outputSpec.label: VCF files
outputSpec.help: Each sample's CNV segments in VCF format.

outputSpec.name: seg
outputSpec.label: SEG table
outputSpec.help: All samples' CNV segments in SEG format, for use with other programs

outputSpec.name: sexes
outputSpec.label: Sample sexes (guessed)
outputSpec.help: Chromosomal sex of each sample, inferred from X- and Y-chromosome coverages
